main event: A civilian reported observing an unidentified object in the sky in Burlington, Massachusetts, which was later concluded to be the star Capella.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 3 minutes and 5 seconds., The observer was located in a second story window when the object was seen., The object was visible continuously until the observer lost sight of it., The sky conditions were partly cloudy at the time of observation., The report suggests physical evidence was present, although no photographs were actually included.
witness description: civilian observer from a second floor window
